Title: A taxonomic reassessment of the genus Balsamia in China
Abstract:
Molecular analysis of the genus Balsamia was conducted
with ITS and 28S sequences available including newly gained sequences
from Chinese specimens. A new hypogeous species, Balsamia lishanensis
was described and illustrated from the North China based on
morphological and molecular evidence. B. lishanensis is mainly
characterized by reddish brown ascomata covered with fine warts, the
whitish gleba with numerous small chambers open to 1 mm, 35 layers
peridium reddish brown polygonal cells and the smooth and regular
ellipsoid ascospores with one large oil drop. Molecular phylogenetic
analyses based on ITS and LSU supported the placement of the new
species. And B. platyspora was confirmed existence in China based on
newly collected specimens. Two species previously described as Barssia
were transferred to Balsamia. A key to four known Chinese species has
been provided.
